markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 12"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Magic Sense](/Feats.aspx?ID=5044) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Arcane" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=11" />
<trait label="Detection" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=43" />
<trait label="Magus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=389" />
<trait label="Oracle" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=817" />
<trait label="Sorcerer" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=824" />
<trait label="Wizard" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=735" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 204 <sup>2.0</sup>, [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 142 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Archetype** [Lich](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=179) (Level 14)

</column>

---

You have a literal sixth sense for ambient magic in your vicinity. You can sense the presence of magic auras as though you were always using a 1st-rank detect magic spell. This detects magic in your field of vision only. When you Seek, you gain the benefits of a 3rd-rank detect magic spell on things you see (in addition to the normal benefits of Seeking). You can turn this sense off and on with a free action at the start or the end of your turn.
name: Magic Sense

summary_markdown: You have a literal sixth sense for ambient magic in your vicinity.
text: <title level="1" right="Feat 12" pfs="Standard" > Magic Sense Source Player Core pg. 204 2.0 , Player Core 2 pg. 142 1.1 Archetype Lich (Level 14) --- You have a literal sixth sense for ambient magic in your vicinity. You can sense the presence of magic auras as though you were always using a 1st-rank detect magic spell. This detects magic in your field of vision only. When you Seek, you gain the benefits of a 3rd-rank detect magic spell on things you see (in addition to the normal benefits of Seeking). You can turn this sense off and on with a free action at the start or the end of your turn.
